description.raw:
pull request #273 improved the precision of `Param::Get` with floating point variables by using `boost::get` when the type is recognized. With boost versions >= 1.58, however, this causes compilation failures when used with unknown types (including the [nightly gazebo builds](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo8-debbuilder/211/)):

* http://www.boost.org/users/history/version_1_58_0.html
* https://svn.boost.org/trac/boost/ticket/547

I added a test that calls `Get<ignition::math::Angle>` on a double param. This passes on [drone](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/1201) and [ubuntu wily with boost 1.54](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-wily-amd64_temp/4/) but [fails to compile with homebrew and boost 1.60](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/59/). I've added an ifdef that uses `boost::relaxed_get` for boost versions >= 1.58.

  • https://svn.boost.org/trac/boost/ticket/547

I added a test that calls Get<ignition::math::Angle> on a double param. This passes on drone and ubuntu wily with boost 1.54 but fails to compile with homebrew and boost 1.60. I've added an ifdef that uses boost::relaxed_get for boost versions >= 1.58.

title: Use boost::relaxed_get with boost version >= 1.58
